DOC.brief_title: Cornell University-Micronutrient Initiative Calcium Supplementation Study
DOC.detailed_description: This study non-inferiority trial compare effect dose strategy involve low overall dose few administration per day current WHO recommendation . The comparator arm , Regimen B , prescribe 3 dos per day ( consistent current WHO standard ) find burdensome qualitative study . The experimental arm , Regimen A , prescribe 2 dos per day associate great satisfaction . On face value Regimen A result 33 % less amount supplement ingest Regimen B . However , hypothesize difference amount ingest , roll routine practice MUCH LESS BECAUSE THE LOWER DOSE REGIMEN RESULTS IN HIGHER LEVELS OF ADHERENCE . We hypothesize THE DIFFERENCE IN AMOUNT CONSUMED WILL BE NEGLIGIBLE OR exceed 15 % . Hence , hypothesize Regimen A inferior Regimen B term total amount supplement ingest ( within 15 % margin inferiority ) .
